channel.title: ASR on Almost Unsupervised Text to Speech and Automatic Speech Recognition
channel.description: Recent content in ASR on Almost Unsupervised Text to Speech and Automatic Speech Recognition

item.title: Audio Sample from "Almost Unsupervised Text to Speech and Automatic Speech Recognition"
item.description: Authors Yi Ren* (Zhejiang University) rayeren613@gmail.com Xu Tan* (Microsoft Research) xuta@microsoft.com Tao Qin (Microsoft Research) taoqin@microsoft.com Sheng Zhao (Microsoft) Sheng.Zhao@microsoft.com Zhou Zhao (Zhejiang University) zhaozhou@zju.edu.cn Tie-Yan Liu (Microsoft Research) tyliu@microsoft.com * Equal contribution. Abstract Text to speech (TTS) and automatic speech recognition (ASR) are two dual tasks in speech processing and both achieve impressive performance thanks to the recent advance in deep learning and large amount of aligned speech and text data.

Abstract Text to speech (TTS) and automatic speech recognition (ASR) are two dual tasks in speech processing and both achieve impressive performance thanks to the recent advance in deep learning and large amount of aligned speech and text data.
